Detailed Description

Represents a context menu which may contain a variable number of items. As items representing an instance of the class AbstractItemContainer recursively contain other items, a context menu also may contain sub menus. It is possible to use custom item renderer properties for each instance of a context menu.

Member Enumeration Documentation

anonymous enum
 

Enumerator:
ID 

Reimplemented from Window.

enum ContextMenu::Corner
 

Corner of the context menu, which is the target for the x- and y-position.

Enumerator:
TopLeft  The x- and y-position describes the top left corner of the context menu.
TopRight  The x- and y-position describes the top right corner of the context menu.
BottomLeft  The x- and y-position describes the bottom left corner of the context menu.
BottomRight  The x- and y-position describes the bottom right corner of the context menu.

Corner  corner = TopLeft,
AbstractItemContainer *  item_cont = 0,

) 
 

Parameters:
x x-position of the corner specified by corner.
x y-position of the corner specified by corner.
corner Corner of the context menu which is the target for the x- and y-position.
item_cont Pointer to the item-container, which contains the items of the context menu.
parent_menu Pointer to the parent context menu, which will be informed by the message ContextMenuClosedMsg if the context menu has been closed.

Reimplemented from Window.

void ContextMenu::SetRenderer (  const ItemRendererProperties *  properties = 0  ) 
 

Sets the renderer used for drawing the items with the specified properties. If this method is not invoked, the default-properties specified by GuiEngineConfig::GetDefaultItemRendererProperties are used.

Parameters:
properties Item-renderer-properties which are used by the renderer.
